titleStmt.title: An Encoded Transcription of Material from the Sylvia Beach Papers

msIdentifier.repository: Princeton University. Library. Dept. of Rare Books and Special Collections

change.ab: Transcribed cards. s1: Lots of crossed out addresses, many illegible "13 Boulevard" could be "93 Boulevard" "4 rue de Rollin, 5e" could be "5c" (unsure of abbrev. convention) s2: "Craunquel 1228" somewhat illegible, best guess s3: "Madeleine Blaess" somewhat illegible, best guess s4: Printed card Unsure of how to mark plaintext accents--text is in French, and many vowels are accented in various ways

body.ab:
1940 4 rue Rollin Odeon 73-44 Tel. [illegible cross-out] Camp, Ruth [illegible cross-out] 5 Square Lamort in Paris XVIc 13 Boulevard St Michel July 1 The Backward Son July 3 3 Poems Spender July 8 12 War and Peace July 29 27 Science of Fairy Tales Aug 5 Aug 2 Folk Lore and the Old Testament Aug 12 5 Books + Theatres Aug 19 12 Arts To-day Sept 11 19 Sexual Question Aug 30 30 Here Lies Sept 2 Sept 2 Sally Bowles Sept 3 (New Add. 4 rue Rollin, 5e) Sept 19 Introductory Lectures on Oct 25 Psycho-Analysis Oct 1 Young Man With a Horn Sept Oct 2 Oct 25 New Negro Nov 20 Nov 4 My Life- Isadora Duncan Nov 15 Nov 20 Winged Pharoah Nov 29 Nov 29 Leaves of Grass Dec 2
SB went with M.B. Jan 29th Brought all RC's things from cellar at 10 rue Rollin to rue de l'Odeon (except trunk which is empty except for clothes hangers & shoe forms). SB paid M.B. for gas, tips to concierge etc FAS 15'0. RC's keys are in drawer of table in shop.
CAMP 145 Bol St Michel June 21 A,B,C of Reading July 29 also returned Craunquel 1228 not listed
Ruth Camp account Madeleine Blaess 1941 Jan 29 on a/c pol by SB 150 Feb " " " " " " 20 tips concierge 45 gas 43 electricity? laundry 20 gas 20,30 electricity 60,00 188,30 paid by Ruth Camp May 26. 1941
Republic Francaise Universite de Paris Annee Scolaire 1939-1940 M.C.T. Seltman, Fellow de Queens' College, delegue de l'Universite de Cambridge (Grande-Bretagne) fera, due 20 au 27 Mai, une serie de quatre conferences, en francais, sur le sujet suivant: La Propagande dans le monde antique (AVEC PROJECTIONS) I. Lundi 20 Mai: La propagande en Grece. II. Mercredi 22 Mai: La propagande dans la Grece Hellenistique. III. Vendredi 24 Mai: La propagande a Rome et dans l'Empire romain. IV. Lundi 27 Mai: La propagande a Byzance et dans l'Occident. Toutes ces conferences auront lieu a 17 heures, a la Sorbonne, Amphitheatre Richelieu.
Vu et approuve: La Recteur, President du Counseil l'Universite, Le Doyen de la Faculte des Lettres, ROUSSY. J. VENDRYES. Paris, I.A.C. (5-40)
